messages.title: Do you remember the time when older people used to be treated with respect?
messages.content: There was a time when other political parties used to agree that: Pensioners are entitled to winter fuel payments to keep warm, The Triple Lock is vital to protect pensioners' incomes, Elderly people should be able to pass their property on to their children and not have it sold to pay for care in their own home.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will invest an extra Â£8billion into care services in the next parliament, reduce hospital waiting times, create a new National Care Service, and ensure elderly people are treated with respect.

issues.health: Labour will always protect our NHS, create a new National Care Service and treat older people with the respect they deserve.
issues.socialWelfare: Labour says: 'these things are not charity they are your rights as citizens.' Citizens who have worked hard and paid your National Insurance Contributions all your lives.

housing.content: Elderly people should be able to pass their property on to their children and not have it sold to pay for care in their own home.

leaflet.personalStatement: I want to tell you that with Labour, that time is and always will be NOW!

contactInformation.address: Pavitt Hall, Union Road, Wembley, HA0 4AU

images.caption: Barry Gardiner outside Pavitt Hall, Union Road, Wembley
